title: I received a "DEMAND NOTICE" Benefit Overpmt from EDD in Calif. Can it be written off in Chapter 7.
question: I received a "DEMAND NOTICE" Benefit Overpayment from Unemployment Office in Calif. It said I owe $1742 because of overpayments received. I am Unemployed at this time and I just entered into Chapter 7 on Dec. 22nd (the day my house was to go up for auction by the Trust Company). Can this debt be added to my Chapter 7 BK? The letter stated that my account has been assigned to collections.
answers:
In many states, if you receive any benefits to which you are not entitled, you will be required to return any benefits received. As in your case, if benefits were paid to you in error, you received a notice stating the amount you were overpaid and why you were not entitled to the benefits. You have the right to appeal the determination. In many states, if you cannot afford to repay the amount of money you owe in full, you can arrange to pay monthly. Remember though, money owed to the government is not discharged in bankruptcy.

Check with a California lawyer in your locale to discuss more of the details.

Good luck to you.

God bless.

This is a tricky questions and I urge you to speak to your lawyer about it.
If the over payment occurred prior to the filing of your bankruptcy case AND there is no fraud involved in the overpayment then it is likely dischargeable in your case. You will need to amend your bankruptcy documents to include this creditor.
You should contact your attorney to discuss this matter in detail.


Good luck.


Robert Kovacs
